My theory for the 'Don't take another life from me':  We know that Banban's genome donor was Adam Uthman, and Adam was close to Weverly Mason. In the player's child's notes, they mention Mason hating Stinger Flynn for some reason. What if Stinger did something to Weverly while he was being tested? In chapter 2, we see a tally chart of Zaps, Handshakes, and Slaps, and we know his stings are powerful. He also has pretty impressive physical strength, so what if Weverly Mason was one of the ones who was slapped or zapped by him? Now, Banban thinks he is Uthman, so I think he hates Stinger Flynn because, in Uthman's memory, Stinger hurt Mason, who was the genome donor for Banbaleena, who is technically Banban's partner.

Alright the whole car = freedom, bus = authoritarianism thing makes me sooo uncomfortable. Because in my experience reality is the exact opposite. When you're a child your parents decide where the car goes, you don't have a say where to go. Even when you're older a car straps you to the expenses to get it, the insurance, the fuel, the fees.  Meanwhile public transportation is freedom. If you're disabled, if you can't drive, if you're a child, it allows you to go where you want. Its cheaper more economical, less tied to lobies that try to stear global politics.  If cars are a symbol for anything its individualism.
